text: The Bartholin's glands are two glands found slightly below and to the left and right of the opening of the vagina in women. == History == They were first found in the 17th century, by the Danish anatomist, Caspar Bartholin the Younger (1655-1738). == Anatomy == The glands secrete mucus to make sexual intercourse easier. Bartholin's glands secrete relatively minute amounts (one or two drops) of fluid when a woman is sexually aroused.Bartholin's Glandfrom Discovery health Sometimes, the Bartholin's glands become infected and can be swollen or painful. This can be treated by a doctor with antibiotics. ==Related pages== * Clitoris * Prostate == References == == Other websites == * - "The Female Perineum: Muscles of the Superficial Perineal Pouch" Category:Anatomy of the female reproductive system Category:Glands
